body.p: However, the Board observed that, conceptually, discounting post‑tax cash flows at a post‑tax discount rate and discounting pre‑tax cash flows at a pre‑tax discount rate should give the same result, as long as the pre‑tax discount rate is the post‑tax discount rate adjusted to reflect the specific amount and timing of the future tax cash flows. The pre‑tax discount rate is generally not the post‑tax discount rate grossed up by a standard rate of tax.
